data.title: Capital visit
data.text: If you like food that looks good this is the place to eat, However, if you like food that taste good this may not be the place to eat . I told myself that maybe it was more Authentic Mex however I really believe it was more microwave mex

data.title: Great Mexican Restaurant!
data.text: My wife and I visited Centro shortly after moving to the Raleigh area and were impressed! We split the enchiladas and they were delicious.  Decor is a little funky and our server was not very attentive, but overall it was a good experience and we will be back.  The menu is more upscale Mexican food so it is pretty expensive, but worth it!

data.title: Muy Delicioso!
data.text: Stopped here on our Taste of Carolina Tour and it was fantastic! Still not really sure what they served us but it was absolutely delicious so who cares.  The tacos looked amazing but I didn't get to try them.  Just gives me a good reason to come back. One of the best margaritas I've ever had and I've been to Mexico so that's a bold statement.  Highly recommend this one.

data.title: Outstanding
data.text: Best steak tacos I ever had. Wait staff very attentive and friendly. Highly recommended! All of our food was fresh and of the highest quality.

data.title: Deliciosa!
data.text: The food, service, atmosphere and location is "everything!" New to area and after several failed attempts at finding great Mexican food, thought we were doomed. But then we find Centro. From the moment we arrived the buzz of the restaurant and the greeting of the hostess set the dining experience. Kristine was our server and she was/is incredible!! Authentic and delicious Mexican food. Even the chips were perfect. Had the guacamole, the enchiladas de la familia and the incredible fried chicken taco. WOW! Amazing! And finally the margarita del gallo, perfection. Not masked with all the sugar, but a purely mixed cocktail! 5 star dining experience. Will be placed in frequent rotation for us.

data.title: Great Mexican food
data.text: Restaurant is a little dark when you enter but great service and food.  Had fish tacos, which are spicy, which I love. I typically don't like avocado but it added just the right compliment to beautifully cooked mahi. Margarita was also really good so Centro will be a frequent stop on trips to downtown Raleigh.

data.title: We Love This Place
data.text: We love Mexican food and have heard about this place so we checked it out. We were glad we did. We went in on a Saturday evening and were lucky to get a couple of bar seats. We started with a couple of margaritas and they were great. Ross and Dan were behind the bar and they provided excellent service. They explained the drinks and menu items and made us feel welcome. We ate at the bar and really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere of the place. We also met John the manager while enjoying our drinks and dinner. He was very nice and made of feel very welcome and appreciated and made sure we had everything we needed and that we enjoyed our experience. This may be a new go to place for us.

data.title: Perfect Lunch
data.text: We were visiting Raleigh doing some family genealogy research and wanted to grab a quick lunch before we headed home.  We were glad we got there as they opened because it did not take long for the place to become packed!  It is a small restaurant but the food was excellent.  I had the fish tacos and my cousin had the enchiladas.  Both were just the right amount, and flavored perfectly!  The service was good even though there was not a seat left in the house when we finished.

data.title: Authentic and fresh Mexican food and flair
data.text:
Centro has been around for quite some time downtown (originally Dos Taquitos) and the food has always been great and reasonably priced.  My last visit came after a two year hiatus and while the interior has changed quite a bit (there is an upstairs bar and tapas now), the menu is pretty much the same and the food still tasty.

The food here is more authentic than American "authentic" Mexican and is primarily locally-sourced.  Their cilantro lime rice is always on point and the combinations are flavors perfectly balanced.  With this being the case, I was a little disappointed by how dry the chicken was.  I am hopeful this is because we had a very late night dinner and the kitchen was close to closing, because in the past the chicken was always juicy.

The service was good and the decor inside is very cool so make sure to look all around the walls (and in the bathroom too).  With the addition of Gallo Pelón Mezcaleria upstairs, the already small seating area is now even smaller, so be prepared for a wait.

Centro's fresh and authentic food never leaves me disappointed, though I remember it being better in the past.  Hopefully that was just because it was end of day, but either way I will keep going back.

data.title: Lunch were the locals eat
data.text:
Spending the day visiting museums, we ate lunch at Centros. We loved the atmosphere. The food was great and farm to table. We went with our 4 year old , which leads to my one complaint, this restaurant is not very kid friendly. There is no kids menu and they charge for kids Milk refills. 

This is a great place to eat as long as you do not have kids.

data.title: Delicious food and drink!
data.text: Really enjoyed the twists on the menu. Everything was cooked perfectly. Waitstaff was excellent and helpful. Definitely going back to try more on the menu!

data.title: One shop stop for delicious Mexican food
data.text: With so many amazing restaurants to chose from in downtown Raleigh, the fact that we go back to Centro time and time again proves how good it is. The atmosphere is cozy and with the addition of a new bar area upstairs serving premium craft cocktails, it's a great year round spot. The food is very authentic and reasonably priced which is also an important factor when spending a night out on the town. The menu is smaller which I like because it means the food they produce is an amazing quality with fresh ingredients, seasonal specials and great presentation. Centro is also one of the only places in the Raleigh area to get fresh, authentic ceviche which keeps me coming back for more.

data.title: Love this quaint find!
data.text: I'm traveling for business and a colleague referred a few places. After walking out of a highly rated restaurant that didn't offer good customer service, we walked to the other end of town to Centro. I'm glad we did. The food and drinks were fresh and wonderful. The customer service was stellar and I loved the atmosphere... As if it transported you to South America. I was very pleased and will return any time I have future business in town.

data.title: Fast service, excellent tacos
data.text:
Our food was out very quickly and the tacos were fantastic.  

One picky complaint is that the portions may be a little small.  It was the perfect size for lunch for me, but would be slightly small for a dinner. 

Atmosphere is fun and tastefully kitschy.

data.title: The Best!
data.text: This has got to be one of the best restaurants that I have visited. You must try the margaritas! Fun, trendy atmosphere. We sat at the bar because there was a long wait for a table and the service was excellent.

data.title: Business Lunch
data.text: We were looking for a for a quick bite to eat before a meeting. Parking was easy. Used Trip Advisor and low and behold Centro popped up.  Decor is something to keep you busy while you wait. I saw some unique items on the walls. We had a nice and knowledgeable Waitress and she was prompt and attentive to our needs. I had the Sola De Pollo soup which was very flavorful. Overall very good.

data.title: Columbian Hang Over Food -- Sign me up!
data.text: Our first stop on a food tour and we immediately wanted to go back!  The agua fresco was fabulous.  Refreshing, fruity and the flavor changes every day.  We sampled the cantaloupe -- excellent. Foodwise the selection was tortillas with chicken and sauce.  The passionate proprietor from Columbia shared her story and how each culture has a hangover curing dish -- this one would be worth drinking a bit too much to savor.  However, even without the excess drinking the dish was perfect.  Balanced flavors, spices, tortillas and cheese with a freshness that was unexpected.  We wished we had and extra day to go back and sample more of the menu.

data.title: Margarita time!
data.text: Excellent food, mexican style everywhere, the enviroment is really fantastic as well as their margaritas! Really enjoyed the mexican art all over the place.

data.title: More than Mexican
data.text: Centro never disappoints. It is our go-to downtown lunch place with good value and high quality. At night the menu expands to offer a wide range of entrees prepared with authentic ingredients and a lot of care. The seasoning is authentic and the food is not too heavy.

data.title: Okay Mexican food convenient for downtown lunch
data.text:
Centro has small tables arranged within a narrow building on Wilmington street.  There's one table outside on a narrow sidewalk.  All of the furniture and the decor is that shabby rustic look with several layers of paint showing through.  It's not all that attractive but interesting.  

We got fairly prompt service.  The lunch menu was literally small - about 6" by 11".  We had to look up what some of the ingredients were like telera bread, which I tried.  It was very a thick toasted bread that was so dry/toasted that it feel apart in my hands, but I liked the flavones of the ingredients of thus sandwich.  I also got a flour taco too as part if my combo order.  It was just okay - more like something you'd find in any restaurant that sells Mexican dishes as one if it's varied offerings.  Luckily we still had some salsa left from our chips and salsa order and it made the taco more spicy.  The salsa  was excellent. My combo was $10.  The lunch menu ranged from $8  to $12.

I only go occasionally because when we have a group of people Mexican food is usually something everyone can agree on.  Otherwise, not a frequent customer .
